intro: Hieracium echioides subsp. freynii, commonly known as the Freyn's Hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and a cluster of small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky areas. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. This subspecies is notable for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and its adaptation to arid environments.
